content.text: The EPR for a single phase fault (phase/neutral) is the product of the part of the fault current flowing into the  earthing system including earthing of earth wires, cable screens, etc, If (A), multiplied by the global  resistance of the earthing system.
Where the earthing system can be represented by an equivalent hemisphere (radius Re), the voltage  decrease V outside the equipotential area is given by Formula (B.1):
